Aragonese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin occupāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /okuˈpa(ɾ)/
  • Syllabification: o‧cu‧par
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

ocupar

  1. (transitive) to occupy

Conjugation

[edit]

This entry needs an inflection-table template.

References

[edit]
  • Bal Palazios, Santiago (2002), “ocupar”, in Dizionario breu de a luenga aragonesa, Zaragoza, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin occupāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [u.kuˈpa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [o.kuˈpa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [o.kuˈpaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)
  • Hyphenation: o‧cu‧par

Verb

[edit]

ocupar (first-person singular present ocupo, first-person singular preterite ocupí, past participle ocupat)

  1. to occupy, to inhabit
  2. to fill, to take up (be in or hold a given place)
  3. to employ, to keep busy
  4. to occupy, to conquer
  5. (reflexive) to occupy oneself, to busy oneself

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund ocupant

negative (no) — no ocupis no ocupi no ocupem no ocupeu no ocupin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • desocupar
  • ocupador
  • ocupar-se

Related terms

[edit]
  • ocupació
  • ocupant

Further reading

[edit]
  • “ocupar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “ocupar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “ocupar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “ocupar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin occupāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /o.kuˈpa(ʁ)/ [o.kuˈpa(h)], /ɔ.kuˈpa(ʁ)/ [ɔ.kuˈpa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /o.kuˈpa(ʁ)/ [o.kuˈpa(h)], /ɔ.kuˈpa(ʁ)/ [ɔ.kuˈpa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /o.kuˈpa(ɾ)/, /ɔ.kuˈpa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /o.kuˈpa(ʁ)/ [o.kuˈpa(χ)], /ɔ.kuˈpa(ʁ)/ [ɔ.kuˈpa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /o.kuˈpa(ɻ)/, /ɔ.kuˈpa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔ.kuˈpaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔ.kuˈpaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔ.kuˈpa.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: o‧cu‧par

Verb

[edit]

ocupar (first-person singular present ocupo, first-person singular preterite ocupei, past participle ocupado)

  1. (transitive) to occupy (to be in possession of)
  2. (transitive) to live in, to reside in
  3. (transitive) to fill, to occupy
  4. (transitive) to exercise, to perform
  5. (transitive) to conquer, to invade
  6. (transitive) to occupy, to preoccupy

Related terms

[edit]
nouns
  • ocupação f

Further reading

[edit]

  • “ocupar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin occupāre. Cognate with English occupy.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /okuˈpaɾ/ [o.kuˈpaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: o‧cu‧par

Verb

[edit]

ocupar (first-person singular present ocupo, first-person singular preterite ocupé, past participle ocupado)

  1. (transitive) to occupy (to take or use space)
  2. (transitive) to occupy (to fill or hold a position)
    ocupar el puesto número ocho ― to be in eighth place
  3. (transitive) to occupy, to take up (time or space)
  4. (transitive) to occupy, to reside in
  5. (transitive) to employ (to hire to work for a job)
    Synonym: emplear
  6. (transitive, Latin America) to use
    Synonyms: usar, utilizar, emplear
  7. (transitive, intransitive, Central America, Mexico) to need
    Synonym: necesitar
    Ocupo ayuda. ― I need help.
  8. (reflexive, with de) to look after (to watch or protect a person)
  9. (reflexive, with de) to take on (a responsibility)
    Synonym: encargarse

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin occupo, occupare. Compare Italian occupare.

Verb

[edit]

ocupar

  1. (transitive) to occupy

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of ocupar (first conjugation)
infinitive ocupar
auxiliary verb aver gerund ocupando
past participle ocupà
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present ocupo (te) ocupi (el/ła) ocupa ocupémo, ocupòn ocupé (i/łe) ocupa
imperfect ocupava (te) ocupavi (el/ła) ocupava ocupàvimo ocupavi (i/łe) ocupava
future ocuparò (te) ocuparè (el/ła) ocuparà ocuparémo ocuparè (i/łe) ocuparà
conditional ocuparìa (te) ocuparisi (el/ła) ocuparìa ocuparìsimo ocuparisi (i/łe) ocuparìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present ocupe, ocupa (te) ocupi (el/ła) ocupe, (el/ła) ocupa ocupémo, ocupone ocupé (i/łe) ocupe, (i/łe) ocupa
imperfect ocupase (te) ocupasi (el/ła) ocupase ocupàsimo ocupasi (i/łe) ocupase
imperative — ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
— (te) ocupa (el/ła) ocupa, (el/ła) ocupe ocupémo ocupé (i/łe) ocupa, (i/łe) ocupe
